Description: Much of boody of Chian Simple Animal Style patterned pottery chalice, with handle roots and top of conical foot; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; three added red bands lined in white at top, mid-wall and on floor; exterior, slip much worn; in handle zone, groups of vertical strokes on either side of handles, between lines; handles black; reserved below; top of foot glazed.
Curator's comments: The sherd is also published in Bergeron, M. forthcoming, ‘Pots and People: Greek trade and votive rituals at Naukratis’, in L. Hulin (ed.), Heracleion in Context: The Maritime Economy of the Egyptian Late Period, Oxford.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0880) (phase 2)
